dict.acceptation: 一英镑，一磅金币；（咀嚼用的）一块，咀嚼物；抵偿物，交换物；

sent.orig: It would be folly to grant that increase without insisting on some quid pro quo.
sent.trans: 不坚持要些报酬就同意那项增长是愚蠢的。

sent.orig: He gives the shop assistant a two-pound coin and only gets change for a quid.
sent.trans: 他给了售货员2英镑的硬币，但是只得到了一英镑的找头。

sent.orig: At the airport she was stung for a few quid for having excess luggage.
sent.trans: 在机场她由于行李超重而被索取几英镑。

sent.orig: It costs a quid to get in.
Do not have a law really, we adds his quid.
